sect2.title: Running Flashlight with Android
sect2.para: You can use Flashlight in collaboration with version 20.0.0 of Google's Android Development Tools (ADT). If you do not have the Android SDK and ADT installed, you can get it by following the instructions here.

formalpara.title: Enable Network Access
formalpara.para: In order for Flashlight to collect data from your Android application, you will need to give your application permission to access your phone's network. You can do this by adding the following to your AndroidManifest.xml:
The Android Manifest Editor also allows you to add this permission in the Permissions tab.

formalpara.title: Launch The Application
formalpara.para: The simplest way to launch the application is to right-click on the project and choose Flashlight As Android Application. Launch Android Application.

figure.title: Launch Flashlight from the Flashlight As menu

formalpara.para: You can also use the create, configure, and run Android Applications from the Flashlight Launch Configuration view. See for more details.

figure.title: Create and manage a run configuration from the Flashlight Configuration View

sect2.title: Stopping Flashlight
sect2.para: Depending on your application, you may need to close the program yourself. How you do this depends on the and version of Android that you are using. Later versions of Android have a Application Monitor widget that is suitable for this purpose. Alternatively, you can leave the program running and manually terminate the instrumentation using the runtime console.
